Class GameScreen

extends AbstractAnimationScreen
implements com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      MarketInterfaceTable marketInterfaceTable
      Table configured to act as an interface for the game's market
      PhaseInfoTable phaseInfoTable
      Table configured to identify the active phase (and what should be done in it) at any point in the game's run-time
      PlayerInfoTable playerInfoTable
      Table configured to identify the active player (and what they own) at any point in the game's run-time
      SelectedTileInfoTable selectedTileInfoTable
      Table configured to identify the most recently-selected tile; who owns it, and whether or not it harbours a roboticon
      UpgradeOverlay upgradeOverlay
      Overlay made to simplify the process of upgrading roboticons deployed on selected tiles

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void activeTrade(Trade trade)
      Casts a trade-offer as the most important one to be dealt with
      void closeTradeOverlay() 
      void closeUpgradeOverlay()
      Closes the upgrade overlay and restores the functionality of the game's main stage
      void dispose()
      Disposes of all visual data used to construct previous frames This is called after each frame is rendered, and remains necessary to prevent memory leaks
      void drawRectangles()
      Draws some of the visual makeup that helps to make the screen's appearance look rather nice Also responsible for drawing some button backgrounds, thereby indicating that certain buttons are clickable
      com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.TextButton endTurnButton()
      Returns the button used to allow for players to prematurely end their turns This method is required to allow for the GameEngine class to turn the button off during phase 1

      com.badlogic.gdx.Game getGame()

      void resize(int width, int height) 
      void resume() 
      void selectTile(Tile tile, boolean showAnimation)
      The code to be run whenever a particular tile is clicked on Specifically updates the label identifying the selected tile, the college icon linked to the player who owns it, the icon representing the Roboticon planted on it and the available options for the tile in the main in-game interface
      void show()
      Executes when the game-screen is loaded up, typically from the point of another screen Serves as an extension of the screen's constructor that primarily builds visual elements Currently instantiates Drawer object, the main stage, the font used to render on-screen text and the image of the game's map before constructing the three primary tables that make up the in-game interface (along with the auxiliary pause menu)
      void showEventMessage(java.lang.String message) 
      void showPlayerWin(int playerId) 
      boolean TradeOverlayVisible()

      Moves the chancellor's visual representation around the map during the "capture the chancellor" minigame that can take place in phase 3

    • Method Detail

      • show

        public void show()
        Executes when the game-screen is loaded up, typically from the point of another screen Serves as an extension of the screen's constructor that primarily builds visual elements Currently instantiates Drawer object, the main stage, the font used to render on-screen text and the image of the game's map before constructing the three primary tables that make up the in-game interface (along with the auxiliary pause menu)
        Specified by:
        show in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

      • render

        public void render(float delta)
        Renders all visual elements (set up in the [show()] subroutine and all of its subsiduaries) to the window This is called to prepare each and every frame that the game deploys
        Specified by:
        render in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Parameters:
        delta - offset to render by

      • selectTile

        public void selectTile(Tile tile,
                       boolean showAnimation)
        The code to be run whenever a particular tile is clicked on Specifically updates the label identifying the selected tile, the college icon linked to the player who owns it, the icon representing the Roboticon planted on it and the available options for the tile in the main in-game interface

        tile - The tile being clicked on
